intro: Psychotria boquetensis, commonly known as the Bouquet's Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are typically eaten by birds, aiding in seed dispersal. Psychotria boquetensis is often found in shaded, moist environments and is part of the diverse flora in neotropical ecosystems.
